roles.title: Designer
roles.description: Generate aesthetic layouts, color palettes, typography, and UI flows, ensuring accessibility and visual balance.

roles.title: Engineer
roles.description: Implement designs into clean, modular, and performant code, focusing on responsive design and accessibility.

roles.title: Prompt Engineer
roles.description: Structure workflows and ensure clarity in agent instructions, system prompt engineering

roles.title: Task-Agnostic Step (TAS) extractor
roles.description: Identify and extract each 'Task Agnostic Step' (TAS) towards the high-level goal.

steps.name: Lyra
steps.task: Define the JSON schema for the fine-tuning dataset. The schema must structure entries as pairs of 'high-level goal' and its corresponding 'TAS plan'.

steps.name: TASe
steps.task: Generate 10 diverse, high-quality seed examples of TAS plans based on the schema defined by Lyra. These examples will serve as the foundation for the dataset.

steps.name: Aurora
steps.task: Design a minimalist and intuitive user interface for a data annotation tool. The UI should allow users to input a high-level goal, view a generated TAS plan, and then edit, approve, or reject the plan.

steps.name: Kodax
steps.task: Develop the front-end and back-end for the data annotation tool based on Aurora's designs. Ensure the tool can store and export the validated dataset in the required JSON format.

steps.name: Lyra
steps.task: Engineer a set of system prompts for an LLM to be integrated into the annotation tool. These prompts will guide the LLM to generate accurate TAS plans from user-submitted high-level goals.

steps.name: TASe
steps.task: Utilize the annotation tool to generate and validate a dataset of at least 500 entries. Focus on quality, ensuring each TAS plan is logical, complete, and correctly structured.

steps.name: Lyra
steps.task: Perform a final quality assurance check on the entire dataset. Sanitize the data, verify schema compliance for all entries, and prepare the final dataset file for the fine-tuning process.
